stories.title: Why TikTok Faces a US Ban Over National Security
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Depending on whom you ask, the short-form video platform TikTok is either a showcase for goofy dances and makeup tutorials or a sophisticated threat to US national security. Because TikTok Inc. is owned by a Chinese company, ByteDance Ltd. — and because China requires its companies, upon request, to share any national security-related data with the government — TikTok’s popularity among Americans carries implications beyond the mobile-phone screen. That’s on top of hand-wringing by parents, educ

stories.title: The AI Chip Behind Nvidia’s Supersonic Stock Rally: QuickTake
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: Computer components are not usually expected to transform entire businesses and industries, but a graphics processing unit Nvidia Corp. released in 2023 has done just that. The H100 data center chip has added more than $1 trillion to Nvidia’s value and turned the company into an AI kingmaker overnight. It’s shown investors that the buzz around generative artificial intelligence is translating into real revenue, at least for Nvidia and its most essential suppliers. Demand for the H100 is so great
abstract: Nvidia’s technology has few rivals at the task of training AI
The chip’s successors are likely to be the H200, then the B100

stories.title: Why Making Computer Chips Has Become a New Global Arms Race
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The incredibly complex, high-stakes business of making semiconductors has always been a battle of corporate giants. Now it’s also a race among governments. These critical bits of technology — also known as integrated circuits or, more commonly, just chips — may be the tiniest yet most exacting products ever manufactured. And because they’re so difficult and costly to produce, there’s a worldwide reliance on just a handful of companies, a dependence that was brought into stark relief by shortages

stories.title: A Cheat Sheet to AI Buzzwords and Their Meanings
stories.autoGeneratedSummary: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot represented a milestone in artificial intelligence that took decades to reach. Scientists were experimenting with “computer vision” and giving machines the ability to “read” as far back as the 1960s. Today it’s possible to imagine a computer performing many human tasks better than people can. Whether you’re worried about being replaced by a robot, or just intrigued by the possibilities, here are some frequently used AI buzzwords and what they mean.
stories.label: AI
stories.byline: Nate Lanxon, Dina Bass and Jackie Davalos
